mjjjhjemj wrote:
> Here are the contents of my surts-source-file:
> +http://(org,banktest,econ,)/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/EXTDEC/EXTRESEARCH/EXTPRRS
> +http://(org,banktest,web,)/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/EXTDEC/EXTRESEARCH/EXTPRRS
> 
> Here are the contents of the resulting surts-dump-file:
> http://(org,banktest,econ,)
> http://(org,banktest,web,)
> 
> The above truncation happens whether I provide the two surt items in
> standard URL or as a surt prefix as above. I thought the truncation
> would only go back to leaving 3 /'s - i.e.
> http://(org,banktest,econ,)/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/
> 
> Have I setup something wrong?

I suspect you have 'seeds-as-surt-prefixes' set, and seeds of the sites' 
root pages. They get converted to SURT prefixes, and then make the 
more-narrow prefixes of your surts-source-file redundant.

- Gordon @ IA
